location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 17/5 Furniture and Stores for the Agency'

physicalDescription.extent: Material in this file is arranged from the front to the rear in chronological order

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 300; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 4-293; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: Correspondence between the Political Agency, Bahrain, and various merchants regarding furniture and office supply orders, plus receipts and bills.The following businesses are correspondents: Richardson and Cruddas; P P Rele and Sons; Whiteaway, Laidlaw & Co. Ltd.; the Bahrain Customs House; the Mesopotamia Corporation Ltd.; the Army and Navy Co-operative Society Ltd; Abbashbai Katimbhai & Brothers; Thacker & Co. Ltd.; Nusserwanjee & Co., Karachi; the New India Assurance Co. Ltd.; Sirdar Carbonic Gas Co. Ltd.; Uberoir, formerly Ganda Singh Uberoi & Co.; H Nizam Din & Sons; Allibhoy Vallijee & Sons; Yusuf bin Ahmed Kannoo; Solignum Ltd.; William Jacks & Co.; John Lysaght Ltd; Dorman Long & Co. Ltd.; Plummer Bros & Co.; the India Rubber, Gutta Percha and Telegraph Works Co. Ltd.; M P Dastur & Co.; J M MacDonald & Co.; Rajputana Cane Chair Mart; Oodhamal & Sons (Johnson); Mackinnon Mackenzie & Co.; Bahrain Radio; Karachi Port Trust; Victoria Furniture Mart; Heal & Son Ltd.; LEP Transport and Depository Ltd.; Maple & Co. Ltd.; the Sind Furniture Mart; Bhimji Lakhmsi & Co.; F P Baker & Co. Ltd.; Liberty & Co.; Lloyd's of London; Frank Strick & Co. Ltd.; the Eastern Bank Ltd.; Wolfe & Hollander Ltd.; Cox & Kings (Insurance) Ltd..
